title: Handlebars - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
The left hand handlebar can be identified by the two dot alignment marks for the alignment to the riser.
The right hand handlebar can be identified by the single dot alignment mark for the alignment to the riser.
Fit a new circlip to the handlebar.
Locate the left hand handlebar in to the left hand riser. Do not fully tighten at this stage.
Rotate the handlebar so that the two alignment marks on the handlebar aligns with the split line of the left hand riser. Tighten the fixings to
Align the left hand switch housing to the handlebar, ensure the locating lug aligns with the hole in the handlebar. Fit the two screws and tighten to 2.5 Nm.
Locate the clutch lever assembly to the handlebar and fit the clamp.
Align the clutch lever split line with the alignment mark on the handlebar. Tighten the clamp fixings, upper one first, to
Fit a new circlip to the handlebar.
Locate the right hand handlebar in to the right hand riser. Do not fully tighten at this stage.
Rotate the handlebar so that the alignment mark on the handlebar aligns with the split line of the right hand riser. Tighten the fixings to
Align the right hand switch housing to the handlebar, ensure the locating lug aligns with the hole in the handlebar. Fit the two fixings and tighten to
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork or frame. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Locate the master cylinder to the handlebars and position the clamp with the UP arrow pointing upwards. Do not tighten the clamp fixings at this stage.
Align the split line of the master cylinder clamp to the alignment mark on the upper surface of the handlebar. Tighten the clamp fixings, upper one first, to

Move the handlebars to the left and right full lock while checking that cables and harnesses do not bind or that the steering feels tight or difficult to turn. A cable or harness that binds, or steering that is tight/difficult to turn will restrict the steering and may cause loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

body.body: Throttle Control - Check for Correct Operation of the Twist Grip
Check the throttle opens and closes smoothly during operation.
Make sure the bar end mirrors or handguards (if fitted) do not interfere with the smooth operation of the twist grip.
A twist grip that does not close fully, operate smoothly or stick in any position will result in a dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Heated grips (if fitted) will expand during operation.
When hot, the clearance between the heated twist grip and the bar end mirror or handguard will decrease.
Always test the heated grips when switched off (cold) and on (hot) to make sure the throttle opens and closes smoothly during operation.
A heated twist grip that does not close fully, operate smoothly or stick during operation will result in a dangerous riding condition leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Check for correct operation of the twist grip. Rectify if necessary.
